intro: Androsace jacquemontii var. jacquemontii, commonly known as the Jacquemont's rock moss, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, basal leaves that are typically hairy and oval in shape. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous environments.
